reported outbreaks.title: African Swine Fever
reported outbreaks.description: There has been a confirmed outbreak of African swine fever [ASF] in pig farms in Nekede, Imo state, Nigeria.Thousands of pigs have been lost due to this disease in the affected farms. The clinical signs include high body temperature above 41 C [105 F], reddish rashes, and a high mortality rate. Younger pigs are mostly affected.The disease was confirmed by the Nigeria Veterinary Research Institute (NVRI) to be ASF. The disease is spreading fast to other pig farms in the

reported outbreaks.title: Anthrax
reported outbreaks.description: Anthrax, caused by the soil-borne bacterium _Bacillus anthracis_, is a disease with important public health and national security implications globally. Understanding the global genetic diversity of the pathogen is important for epidemiological and forensic investigations of anthrax events. Toward this, we describe _B. anthracis_ genetic diversity in Nigeria and confirm it belongs to a unique West African genetic group not yet reported beyond neighboring Cameroon and Chad and Mali. reported outbreaks.description: SummaryOn 16 Jan 2015, Nigeria confirmed the presence of H5N1 HPAI to the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE). This was the 1st occurrence of H5N1 HPAI in the country since the last epidemic between 2006 and 2008.
